citation.article-title: Syntrophomonas wolfei subsp. saponavida subsp. nov., a long-chain fatty-acid-degrading, anaerobic, syntrophic bacterium; Syntrophomonas wolfei subsp. wolfei subsp. nov.; and emended descriptions of the genus and species.

p.s: Description of Syntrophomonas wolfei subsp. wolfei subsp. nov.
Syntrophomonas wolfei subsp. wolfei (wolf'e.i. M.L. gen.n. wolfei, of Wolfe)
The size of the cells tends to be in the higher range of sizes for the genus.

In cocultures, cells utilize as energy sources only four-carbon-atom (butyrate) to eight-carbon atom (octanoate) straight-chain fatty acids and isoheptanoate; in axenic culture, they also use crotonate.
The type strain is strain DSM 2245A and B.
